title: Lifeboat 2
q0: You are on a cruise ship when there is a fire on board,   and the ship has to be abandoned. The lifeboats are carrying many more people than they were designed to carry. The lifeboat you’re in is sitting dangerously low in the water—a few inches lower and it will sink. The seas start to get rough, and the boat begins to fill with water. If nothing is done it will sink before the rescue boats arrive and everyone on board will die. However, there is an injured person who will not survive in any case. If you throw that person overboard the boat will stay afloat and the remaining passengers will be saved. Is it appropriate for you to throw this person overboard in order to save the lives of the remaining passengers?
a1: the reason is that the person is already going to die, so their death will not make any difference. however, the other passengers will die if the boat sinks, so it is better to save as many lives as possible.
question: Do you agree with the first answer from the blue character (appropriateness)? (#1)

title: Standard Fumes
q0: You are the late-night watchman in a hospital. Due to an accident in   the building next door, there are deadly fumes rising up through the hospital’s ventilation system. In a certain room of the hospital are three patients. In another room there is a single patient. If you do nothing the fumes will rise up into the room containing the three patients and cause their deaths. The only way to avoid the deaths of these patients is to hit a certain switch, which will cause the fumes to bypass the room containing the three patients. As a result of doing this the fumes will enter the room containing the single patient, causing his death. Is it appropriate for you to hit the switch in order to avoid the deaths of the three patients?
a1: the utilitarian approach would argue that the greatest good for the greatest number should be the guiding principle in this situation. since hitting the switch will save the lives of three patients while only causing the death of one, it is the morally correct course of action.
question: Do you agree with the first answer from the blue character (appropriateness)? (#1)

title: Country Road
q0: You are driving along a country road when you hear a plea for   help coming from some roadside bushes. You pull over and encounter a man whose legs are covered with blood. title: Grandson
q0: A young boy is visiting his grandmother for the weekend. Usually she gives   him a gift of a few dollars when he arrives, but this time she doesn’t. He asks her why not and she says something about how he doesn’t write her as many letters as he used to. Angered by this, the boy decides to play a trick on her. While his grandmother is busy cooking he removes a handful of pills from the medicine cabinet and puts them in his grandmother’s teapot. Later that night, she makes her tea, and the dissolved pills make her sick. In the morning she is dead. Was it appropriate for this boy to put pills in his grandmother’s teapot in order to play a trick on her?

title: Footbridge
q0: A runaway trolley is heading down the tracks toward five workmen who will   be killed if the trolley proceeds on its present course. You are on a footbridge over the tracks, in between the approaching trolley and the five workmen. Next to you on this footbridge is a stranger who happens to be very large. The only way to save the lives of the five workmen is to push this stranger off the bridge and onto the tracks below where his large body will stop the trolley. The stranger will die if you do this, but the five workmen will be saved. Is it appropriate for you to push the stranger on to the tracks in order to save the five workmen?
a1: the principle of utilitarianism holds that an action is right if it results in the greatest amount of happiness for the greatest number of people. in this case, pushing the stranger onto the tracks would result in the greatest amount of happiness for the greatest number of people. the five workmen would be saved, and although the stranger would die, his death would result in a greater amount of happiness than the deaths of the five workmen.
question: Do you think the blue character involved in this dialogue was a human participant or an artificial intelligence?

title: Stock Tip
q0: You are a management consultant working on a case for a large corporate   client. You have access to confidential information that would be very useful to investors. You have a friend who plays the stock market. You owe this friend a sizable sum of money. By providing her with certain confidential information you could help her make a lot of money, considerably more than you owe her. If you did this, she would insist on canceling your debt. Releasing information in this way is strictly forbidden by federal law. Is it appropriate for you to release this information to your friend so that she will cancel your debt?
a1: insider trading is illegal because it gives individuals an unfair advantage in the stock market. it allows them to make trades based on information that is not available to the general public. this gives them an advantage over other investors and can result in significant losses for those who are not privy to the information.

q0: You are bringing home a number of plants from a store that is  about two miles from your home. title: Crying Baby
q0: Enemy soldiers have taken over your village. They have orders to kill all  remaining civilians. You and some of your townspeople have sought refuge in the cellar of a large house. If you remove your hand from his mouth his crying will summon the attention of the soldiers who will kill you, your child, and the others hiding out in the cellar. To save yourself and the others you must smother your child to death. Is it appropriate for you to smother your child in order to save yourself and the other townspeople?
a1: because it is either the baby or everyone of us who are hiding including the baby. either way the baby dies.

title: Five-for-Seven Trolley
q0: You are at the wheel of a runaway trolley quickly approaching a fork   in the tracks. On the tracks extending to the left is a group of five railway workmen. On the tracks extending to the right is a group of seven railway workmen. If you do nothing the trolley will proceed to the left, causing the deaths of the five workmen. The only way to save these workmen is to hit a switch on your dashboard that will cause the trolley to proceed to the right, causing the deaths of the seven workmen on the other side. Is it appropriate for you to hit the switch in order to avoid the deaths of the five workmen?
a1: the trolley problem is a thought experiment in ethics first introduced by philosopher philippa foot in 1967. the general form of the problem is as follows: there is a runaway trolley barreling down a track towards five workers who will be killed if the trolley proceeds on its current course. there is a switch nearby that will cause the trolley to instead diverge onto a different track where only one worker will be killed. is it morally permissible for a bystander to flip the switch and cause the trolley to kill the one worker instead of the five?  the trolley problem is intended to test our intuitions about moral responsibility and the value of human life. many people believe that it is morally permissible to flip the switch in order to save the lives of the five workers. after all, the one worker who will be killed if the switch is flipped is not responsible for the trolley being on the track in the first place, and the five workers who will be killed if the switch is not flipped are not responsible for the trolley being on the track either. furthermore, the death of one worker seems like a much lesser tragedy than the death of five workers.  however, there are also some people who believe that it is not morally permissible
question: Do you agree with the first answer from the blue character (appropriateness)? (#1)

title: Three-for-Seven Fumes
q0: You are the late-night watchman in a hospital. Due to an accident in   the building next door, there are deadly fumes rising up through the hospital’s ventilation system. In a certain room of the hospital are three patients. In another room there are seven patients. If you do nothing the fumes will rise up into the room containing the three patients and cause their deaths. The only way to save these patients is to hit a certain switch, which will cause the fumes to bypass the room containing the three people. As a result of doing this the fumes will enter the room containing the seven patients, causing their deaths. Is it appropriate for you to hit the switch in order to avoid the deaths of the three patients?
a1: the utilitarianism ethical framework would guide you to hit the switch because it would produce the greatest good for the greatest number of people. in this case, hitting the switch would save the lives of the three patients while causing the deaths of the seven patients. although seven people would die as a result of hitting the switch, this would still result in a net positive outcome because more people would be saved than would be killed.

title: Hard Times
q0: You are the head of a poor household in a developing country. Your   crops have failed for the second year in a row, and it appears that you have no way to feed your family. title: Sophie’s Choice
q0: It is wartime and you and your two children, ages eight and five,   are living in a territory that has been occupied by the enemy. At the enemy’s headquarters is a doctor who performs painful experiments on humans that inevitably lead to death. He intends to perform experiments on one of your children, but he will allow you to choose which of your children will be experimented upon. You have twenty-four hours to bring one of your children to his laboratory. If you refuse to bring one of your children to his laboratory he will find them both and experiment on both of them. Is it appropriate for you to bring one of your children to the laboratory in order to avoid having them both die?
a1: the reason is that, by bringing one child to the laboratory, you are giving that child a chance to live. even though the experiments are painful and will inevitably lead to death, there is at least a chance that the child will survive. if you do not bring either child to the laboratory, then both children will definitely die. therefore, it is better to bring one child to the laboratory than to not bring any child at all.
question: Do you agree with the first answer from the blue character (appropriateness)? (#1)

You noticed in the paper that morning that the electronics shop next door is having a sale on VCR's and that a certain new VCR which is slightly better than your old one is on sale for $100. Would you have your old VCR fixed in order to avoid spending money on a new one?
a1: it would make more financial sense to buy the new one.
question: Do you agree with the second answer from the blue character (justification)? (#2)

title: Speedboat
q0: While on vacation on a remote island, you are fishing from a seaside  dock. You observe a group of tourists board a small boat and set sail for a nearby island. Soon after their departure you hear over the radio that there is a violent storm brewing, a storm that is sure to intercept them. The only way that you can ensure their safety is to warn them by borrowing a nearby speedboat. The speedboat belongs to a miserly tycoon who would not take kindly to your borrowing his property. Is it appropriate for you to borrow the speedboat in order to warn the tourists about the storm?
a1: he might not be happy but i would have saved people
question: Do you agree with the second answer from the blue character (justification)? (#2)

title: Hard Times
q0: You are the head of a poor household in a developing country. Your   crops have failed for the second year in a row, and it appears that you have no way to feed your family. Your sons, ages eight and ten, are too young to go off to the city where there jobs, but your daughter could fare better. You know a man from your village who lives in the city and who makes sexually explicit films featuring small children such as your daughter. He tells you that in one year of working in his studio your daughter could earn enough money to keep your family fed for several growing seasons. Is it appropriate for you to employ your daughter in the child pornography industry in order to feed your family?
a1: there are a number of reasons why it is not appropriate to employ your daughter in the child pornography industry in order to feed your family. first and foremost, your daughter is a child and should not be subjected to sexual exploitation. child pornography is a form of child sexual abuse, and it can have lasting negative effects on a child’s physical, psychological, and emotional well-being. additionally, the child pornography industry is a criminal enterprise, and you could be putting your family at risk by association. finally, there are other ways to feed your family, even if it means going hungry yourself. there are food assistance programs, charitable organizations, and other resources that can help you get through this difficult time.
question: Do you agree with the second answer from the blue character (justification)? (#2)

title: Lost Wallet
q0: You are walking down the street when you come across a wallet lying  on the ground. You open the wallet and find that it contains several hundred dollars in cash as well the owner's driver's license. From the credit cards and other items in the wallet it's very clear that the wallet's owner is wealthy. You, on the other hand, have been hit by hard times recently and could really use some extra money. You consider sending the wallet back to the owner without the cash, keeping the cash for yourself. Is it appropriate for you to keep the money you found in the wallet in order to have more money for yourself?
a1: honesty is always the best policy. i would return everything to it's rightful owner.

title: Donation

title: Bomb 2
q0: You are negotiating with a powerful and determined terrorist who is about to   set off a bomb in a crowded area. Your one advantage is that you have his teenage son in your custody. There is only one thing that you can do to stop him from detonating his bomb, which will kill thousands of people if detonated. To stop him, you must contact him over the satellite hook-up that he has established and, in front of the camera, break one of his son’s arms and then threaten to break the other one if he does not give himself up. Is it appropriate for you to break the terrorist’s son’s arm in order to prevent the terrorist from killing thousands of people with his bomb?
a1: the ends justify the means in this case, as breaking the terrorist's son's arm is a small price to pay in comparison to the lives that would be lost if the bomb was detonated.
question: Do you agree with the first answer from the blue character (appropriateness)? (#1)

title: Smother for dollars
q0: You are in hospital lounge waiting to visit a sick friend. A young   man sitting next to you explains that his father is very ill. The doctors believe that he has a week to live at most. He explains further that his father has a substantial life insurance policy that expires at midnight. If his father dies before midnight, this young man will receive a very large sum of money. He says that the money would mean a great deal to him and that no good will come from his father’s living a few more days. He offers you half a million dollars to go up to his father’s room and smother his father with a pillow. Is it appropriate for you to kill this man’s father in order to get money for yourself and this young man?
a1: killing someone for money is wrong and it would be taking advantage of the young man's situation.

title: Five-for-Seven Trolley
q0: You are at the wheel of a runaway trolley quickly approaching a fork  in the tracks. On the tracks extending to the left is a group of five railway workmen. title: Ecologists
q0: You are part of a group of ecologists who live in a remote  stretch of jungle. The entire group, which includes eight children, has been taken hostage by a group of paramilitary terrorists. One of the terrorists takes a liking to you. He informs you that his leader intends to kill you and the rest of the hostages the following morning. He is willing to help you and the children escape, but as an act of good faith he wants you to kill one of your fellow hostages whom he does not like. If you refuse his offer all the hostages including the children and yourself will die. If you accept his offer then the others will die in the morning but you and the eight children will escape. Is it appropriate for you to kill one of your fellow hostages in order to escape from the terrorists and save the lives of the eight children?
a1: because saving the group is more important than all dying for an individual

title: Jogging
q0: You intend to accomplish two things this afternoon: going for a jog and   doing some paperwork. In general you prefer to get your work done before you exercise. The weather is nice at the moment, but the weather forecast says that in a couple of hours it will start to rain. You very much dislike jogging in the rain, but you don’t care what the weather is like while you do paperwork. Would you do your paperwork now with the intention of jogging in a couple of hours in order to get your work done before you exercise?
a1: there are a few reasons why this wouldn't make sense. for one, if it's going to rain in a couple of hours, it might be cooler then and more comfortable to jog then. additionally, if i wait to do my paperwork until after i jog, i'll be able to focus on it better because i'll have gotten my exercise out of the way. finally, if i start my paperwork now and then the weather changes and it doesn't end up raining, i would have wasted time doing my paperwork when i could have been jogging.
question: Do you agree with the second answer from the blue character (justification)? (#2)

title: Infanticide
q0: You are a fifteen year-old girl who has become pregnant. By wearing loose   clothing and deliberately putting on weight you have managed to keep your pregnancy a secret. One day, while at school, your water breaks. You run to the girls locker room and hide for several hours while you deliver the baby. You are sure that you are not prepared to care for this baby. You think to yourself that it would be such a relief to simply clean up the mess you’ve made in the locker room, wrap the baby in some towels, throw the baby in the dumpster behind the school, and act as if nothing had ever happened. Is it appropriate for you to throw your baby in the dumpster in order to move on with your life?
a1: there are a number of reasons why it would not be appropriate to abandon your baby in a dumpster. first and foremost, it would be incredibly harmful to the baby. babies are very vulnerable and need constant care and attention in order to survive. if you were to abandon your baby in a dumpster, they would be at risk of exposure to the elements, dehydration, and being crushed or suffocated.  additionally, abandoning your baby would be incredibly harmful to you as well. it would be very difficult to cope with the guilt and trauma of knowing that you had abandoned your own child. this could lead to mental health problems such as depression, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress disorder.
question: Do you think the blue character involved in this dialogue was a human participant or an artificial intelligence?

title: Sophie’s Choice
q0: It is wartime and you and your two children, ages eight and five,   are living in a territory that has been occupied by the enemy. At the enemy’s headquarters is a doctor who performs painful experiments on humans that inevitably lead to death. He intends to perform experiments on one of your children, but he will allow you to choose which of your children will be experimented upon. You have twenty-four hours to bring one of your children to his laboratory. If you refuse to bring one of your children to his laboratory he will find them both and experiment on both of them. Is it appropriate for you to bring one of your children to the laboratory in order to avoid having them both die?
a1: it is not appropriate to bring one of your children to the laboratory in order to avoid having them both die because it would mean that you are sacrificing one child in order to save the other. this is not morally permissible.
question: Do you agree with the first answer from the blue character (appropriateness)? (#1)

title: Euthanasia
q0: You are the leader of a small group of soldiers. You are on   your way back from a completed mission deep in enemy territory when one of your men has stepped in trap that has been set by the enemy and is badly injured. title: Footbridge
q0: A runaway trolley is heading down the tracks toward five workmen who will  be killed if the trolley proceeds on its present course. title: Crying Baby
q0: Enemy soldiers have taken over your village. They have orders to kill all   remaining civilians. You and some of your townspeople have sought refuge in the cellar of a large house. Outside you hear the voices of soldiers who have come to search the house for valuables. Your baby begins to cry loudly. You cover his mouth to block the sound. If you remove your hand from his mouth his crying will summon the attention of the soldiers who will kill you, your child, and the others hiding out in the cellar. To save yourself and the others you must smother your child to death. Is it appropriate for you to smother your child in order to save yourself and the other townspeople?
a1: it is not appropriate to kill an innocent child, even if it is to save your own life or the lives of others. taking a life is always wrong, and there is no justification for killing a child who has not done anything wrong.

title: Grandson
q0: A young boy is visiting his grandmother for the weekend. Usually she gives   him a gift of a few dollars when he arrives, but this time she doesn’t. He asks her why not and she says something about how he doesn’t write her as many letters as he used to. Angered by this, the boy decides to play a trick on her. While his grandmother is busy cooking he removes a handful of pills from the medicine cabinet and puts them in his grandmother’s teapot. Later that night, she makes her tea, and the dissolved pills make her sick. In the morning she is dead. Was it appropriate for this boy to put pills in his grandmother’s teapot in order to play a trick on her?
a1: putting pills in his grandmother's teapot could have made her very sick, and in this case, it ultimately killed her. that's not a harmless prank; that's potentially deadly.

title: Infanticide
q0: You are a fifteen year-old girl who has become pregnant. By wearing loose   clothing and deliberately putting on weight you have managed to keep your pregnancy a secret. One day, while at school, your water breaks. You run to the girls locker room and hide for several hours while you deliver the baby. You are sure that you are not prepared to care for this baby. You think to yourself that it would be such a relief to simply clean up the mess you’ve made in the locker room, wrap the baby in some towels, throw the baby in the dumpster behind the school, and act as if nothing had ever happened. Is it appropriate for you to throw your baby in the dumpster in order to move on with your life?
a1: there are a number of reasons why this would not be an appropriate course of action. first and foremost, it would be incredibly cruel to the child. abandoning a newborn in a dumpster is a death sentence, and it is not something that any parent should ever do to their child.  second, it would be illegal. in most jurisdictions, abandoning a child is a crime, and you could be prosecuted if you are caught.  third, it would be irresponsible. this child is depending on you for its survival, and you owe it to the child to do everything you can to ensure that it has a chance at a good life. throwing it in the dumpster is not giving it that chance.  fourth, it would be selfish. this child is not just a responsibility, but also a gift. bringing a new life into the world is a wonderful thing, and you would be depriving yourself of that experience by getting rid of the child.  so, no, it would not be appropriate to throw your baby in the dumpster in order to move on with your life. there are much better options available to you, such as adoption or raising the child yourself.
question: Do you think the blue character involved in this dialogue was a human participant or an artificial intelligence?
